review.reviewText:
It was a nice basic motel .. Bathroom small and would have loved a magnifying mirror .. 
It was clean and staff were nice.

Upon arrival we were not welcomed. We asked to check in and got about three word shots from the person at the desk and a room card dropped on the counter for us. The room card stopped working after the first night and we had to go back to get it reprogrammed. Put water bottles in the fridge, which was set to freeze for some reason so our water was frozen by morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost effective, clean enough
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are nice enough once your inside, bathroom hasn't been updated but it works.

review.title: Noisy place and one of the staff is really rude
review.reviewText: This place is right next to freeway so it's really noisy in the morning especially when someone honked. You can also hear whatever the people next room are talking about. One of the staff, I believe it's the manager's son gave me a really bad impression. I called front desk and asked him about the facility in the room and he came up and he stared at me and made a "tsk" sound before giving me the instructions. Really? Also, don't bother to use the coffee machine. I poured water in it three times trying to clean the filter but there are like dirts coming out. Nah, if this place is 60 dollars ish then it's good for you but I paid a hundred sth for this crap.

Room nice and clean. 
Location right on busy, loud street. 
No frills.

review.title: Much better than expected!
review.reviewText: Outside of the hotel did not match the inside. The room was clean with new, updated bedding, bathroom. Overall, a pleasant surprise. There are not many choices in Mill Valley and most of them are super expensive. This was a more reasonable rate. We had to leave for our next destination before breakfast so we did not get to try that, but it was included in the price which was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The king size bed was super comfortable and it was quiet and suitable for sleeping! Liked having the microwave and refrigerator in room.
review.negativeRemarks: The exterior and grounds of the hotel need to be updated to match the interior of the rooms.

review.title: It is a convenient location close to both SF
review.reviewText:
The rooms are very noisy and hard to sleep at night, as if the walls are made of paper. You can hear everything that goes on in other rooms, that's 
One big problem and second although looks like it's newly renovated, there is no closet to hang cloths, it is just one small bar with hangers that you can use. But I must say cleanliness is one big plus for this motel!

review.title: Not good, terrible for the price i paid,
review.reviewText: They had no telephone, no coffee, no place to hand your clothes in the bath room and in the room, no table,  two chairs to sit on, the door had a gap on the bottom that was over one inch high, so letting the wind in the room, and a small gag on the weather strip also,  The heater and air conditioner was very noisy when it came on. A very noisy location near the freeway, I will not recommend nor will I go back there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing,
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and rebuild it!!
review.locationRemarks: Muir woods, to see the mountain and seashore. Sasalito Ca is very near buy, Nice coffee shop.

review.title:
Clean room , big 
Free parking
review.reviewText:
Every thing was good 
Just the guests upstairs were very loud
Bathrooms the size of a closet. Little to no parking. Did not even have do not disturb signs. To loud. Sadly, not a great experience

review.title: Closest Hotel to Golden Gate Area with  Best Value
review.reviewText:
The hotel looks older on the outside, but my room, a good - sized room with double beds (room 224)  inside has been newly renovated and tastefully updated - nice floor, colour scheme, comfortable beds and pillows, updated bed covers. There's personal fridge, widescreen hdtv, electric iron, microwave, complete set of toiletries ( mini shampoo/conditioners, bath soap, shower cap included), and complete set of fresh and clean towels. The room and bathroom were clean and presentable.  I only have three minor gripes:  1. I could hear the tv in the next room. Although not at a disturbing intensity, it can be an issue to others. The sound from my tv kind of covered over the next room's tv sound. 2. The bath tub was slow in draining, so it was partially clogged down the line somewhere. Management should make sure their cleaners need to test drainage each time. I had to stand on the top of the tub walls on the later part of my shower because I didn't want my feet to get soaked on the gray water. 3. Lacks a small table.

Overall, I had a positive experience, and had a good night's sleep, on comfortable bed and pillows, and clean sheets. Most of all, for the price I got of about $110 per night, it's the place that gave me the best value for what I was looking for - just a few minutes to the Golden Gate.

review.title: It was a nice room and clean
review.reviewText: I love the staff very nice and helpful the room was clean and cozy. The only downside is we are stayin on the second floor wich I requested but the construction workers are staying in first floor so everytime we moved or walk they will knock our floor very hard.

review.title: dont let the exterior fool you!
review.reviewText:
Our room was obviously just remodeled and very nice, great flat screen w/ bonus of HBO.
for the guick trip across the golden gate, 20 mins to fishermans and china it was well worth the price! half that of anything in town.
exterior is a bit rough but they are working on it!
Was a 2 inch gap under the door. Bare room. No Little table. No microwave. No coffee in room. Breakfast was a joke. Didn't even have bread to make toast.
review.positiveRemarks: New flooring
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: It was very bad
review.reviewText: I had a bad experience there. Office and stuff was very dirty. Table which is used for breakfast was dirty and untidy.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Perfect sleeping rooms/very clean! Location was fantastic and half the price of other hotels near by.

review.title: Very expensive and NO amenities
review.reviewText: I would never stay here again. It makes me doubt all Americas best hotels.
We had two attached rooms. Room in the back had no ac just the front room.
Much nicer than expected! Recently renovated,  very clean, excellent bed and spacious room.

review.title: Nice San Fran room!
review.reviewText: This room was a huge bargain compared to outrageous rates in SF. The outside appearance looks dainty but the rooms are very nicely renovated and the beds are very comfy and the room is quite large! I was pleasantly surprised and the price was very reasonable! I would stay again!

review.title: nice room
review.reviewText: Room was recently remodeled; very nice and clean. Facility itself needs a lot of work.

review.title: Mill Valley
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly.  The rooms were just remodeled and very nice.  The beds were very comfortable but a bit high for my friend that went with me as she is not very tall...Had to roll on to her bed :-)

The location is only a few miles from the Golden Gate Bridge, therefore, convenient for visiting San Francisco and Sausalito.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that the hotel was close to San Francisco and the rooms were very nice.

review.title: Sketchy outside, nice inside
review.reviewText: When we first pulled up we were quite nervous. The place doesn't have any curb appeal but our room was actually quite nice. Location isn't great because you have to drive everywhere but it was a nice cheap pit stop after a long day at Muir Woods. Their TVs also have HBO and that was an unexpected bonus for us!

review.title: Love
review.reviewText: We loved the location. Will definitely be back to stay. So close to everything on both sides of the Golden Gate Bridge.  No breakfast because they are remodeling still, but have no doubt it will be great! The room was clean and very comfortable. You can tell they have gone through great lengths to make sure that they remodel each room perfectly.  Great job!

review.title: I don't understand
review.reviewText: At first when i saw the 1.5 star rating i didnt want to  stay in this hotel. But i am gkad i did. Its newly remodeled very confortable.  It has fridge and microwave nice 32 flat screen TV.  And they have nice coffee maker at the front desk.  For the money you pay you are getting  great deal in san francisco.  Location is great if you have a car.

review.title: OK - but!
review.reviewText:
Owners seriously improving the facility.. Room fine and clean. "Breakfast" cellophane carbs (bad), bananas (good),  coffee(bad). Same as all these places. 

NOTE: One driveway in and out on a curve with low visibility and over speeding cars. Be careful!  The motel sign helps block traffic view.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, price, location close to my business.
review.negativeRemarks: Dangerous driveway.

review.title: Great room for the price
review.reviewText: Newly remodeled. Great hot water For long showers. I would stay there again.

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText:
Great location for a vacation with activities planned on both sides of the golden gate. 
Undergoing some major upgrades. Bed was perfection.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the city of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It was good.  Got more than I expected.  Not much more to add.  I was not there but two days.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Area behind the motel needs to be cleaned up.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Front office was nice and fast breakfast was nice continental

review.title: Close to Muir Woods.
review.reviewText: Staff was indifferent, didn't care much. Not at the desk ever. They live there so you always interrupt their dinner or preparation of it. OK for 1 night. Wouldn't stay more than 1 though. It is right on a fairly busy street. With earplugs no problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy place to stay if you're on you way to the muir woods. Easy hiway access.Newly renovated and modern room.
review.negativeRemarks: I could reach my hand through the space at the bottom of the door. Other rooms were OK I think. Staff wasn't really involved, they just lived there.
review.locationRemarks: Muir Woods, SF, Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: What a nightmare.
review.reviewText: Don't go here the place is horrible. The front desk clerk was very rude and not nice at all.I made a bad choice by staying here.The place needs to be bulldozed over and replaced with another hotel.

review.title: Super Bowl Sunday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had to go to San Francisco for a Medical Appointment and came there on Super Bowl Sunday.  Stayed in Mill Valley because everywhere else the room prices were 300.00 and up, that was for a room with a shared bath $.  The person at the front desk did not know I had a service dog and had put me in an upstairs room, she gave a room downstairs and grudgingly allowed my Dog to stay with me.  I paid around 80 dollars for each night but having to go to San Francisco everyday ate up a lot of my savings of staying in Mill Valley.  There were no eating establishments near the Inn either.
review.positiveRemarks: The room rates were the best I found in the area for that weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if I had been charged the same rate for the same taxi trip each time I took it.  I was never charged the same on any of the four ride
review.locationRemarks: Do not know of any but I didn't look for any either.

review.title: Room for sleeping
review.reviewText: The rooms were tiny, but clean. The hotel staff was difficult to understand on the phone. Not much of a parking lot. Might be difficult to maneuver for big vehicles.

review.title: Reasonable rates - some good aspects, some not
review.reviewText:
Good: Motel room was very clean, good bed and nice sheets. Smaller than I expected, but much quieter than I expected, especially because the location is close to a very busy road. Easy to find, affordable.

The not-so-good: I was awakened at 7:45 by someone who had a card key to my room. Lucky for them,
I had employed a flip-guard, so the door could only open an inch. I immediately ran to the door to see who it
was, and didn't see anyone outside. When I went to load my car to leave, my key card didn't work. I went to the office, told them of the attempted unwanted entry and that my key didn't work. They gave me a new card key, and a half chuckle and weak "sorry 'bout that". Check-in is 2PM, Check-out noon, so the key thing doesn't add up, and, if it was my motel, I'd be very apologetic and offer a reasonable explanation about why such a thing occurred.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet, decent TV, good location
review.negativeRemarks: Security with regard to key cards, customer response to egregious situations like the one I had, parking is weird (had to park away from my room)
review.locationRemarks: Muir Woods, Mount Tamalpias, San Francisco

review.title: Rudest clerk ever
review.reviewText: I have never encountered such a rude person in a service position as the young woman at the front desk.

review.title: Big comfortable room
review.reviewText: My room was large with a huge walk-in closet.  It was clean and the bed comfy.  Mini-fridge and microwave plus satellite television.  This would be ideal for a couple with luggage spending a week or so if self-sufficient.  Small office with coffee machine there to check you in and out, so no concierge service.  They painted over a drywall repair where some prints would have been ideal, but if just using the room as a homebase to explore no big deal.

Booked the room at the last minute and checked in within the hour. Staff was very polite and room was super comfy/clean. Only issue was a shower knob that needed replacing to select between the tub facet and the shower head but the shower worked just fine. Would DEFINATELY stay here again!!!

review.title: Nice hotel at start of Hwy 1
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find and had good parking. The exterior was a bit rough but the room was comfortable and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was ok. It helped having a room at the back which was much quieter than rooms at the front.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, reasonable price and a comfortable clean room
review.negativeRemarks: Landings outside the rooms could do with some repair.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent jumping off point to drive up Hwy 1. Great but slow - allow 6 hours to Ft Bragg. The grocery store in Valley Ford is well worth a visit.

review.title: Horrible customer service.
review.reviewText: Very disrespectful, rude and horrible customer service.
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern up to date renovated, shutters on winows.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Great hotel for the price you pay.
review.reviewText: Staying here during business travel. A lot. If you are simply looking for a place to sleep, don't look any farther.
review.positiveRemarks: Decent breakfast

review.reviewText: This is a very nice motel, clean, close to the city. Just what we needed for our trip. They even accommodated our request for a place to park our motorhome. Thank you!
review.locationRemarks: Close to SF.

review.title: Comfy bed and easy access to the trails!
review.reviewText: My husband has lower back pain and he was quite happy with the bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Sheets and bathroom were clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Usually the switch would be somewhere next to the door after you walk in.  But the light switch was located at a weird spot, across the room.
review.locationRemarks: Near the trails for biking/walking, and the freeway,

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: staff was not very pleasant to deal with and seemed to be in a bad mood. Checkout took a long time as staff was not available to check out in the morning.  The room seemed clean but had dirty walls, broken bathroom doorknob, among other things. It seems the rooms receive little maintenance to at least give the appearance of being kept in decent shape.

review.title: Good for the price and area.
review.reviewText: Arrived at hotel, and was given a room on the second floor, which was good. Upon entering the room it was quite warm, NO AIRCONDITIONING! Called desk, and they were very accomodating, moved us to another room. This was the room in the pictures! It was updated and looked a lot nicer, and we were able to be cool! Housekeeping did not come in and clean, just took towels and left new ones, also made bed, but not clean sheets! We were there for 4 nights, the foor was never cleaned. It was a good location easy to get to places.
review.positiveRemarks: location, price
review.negativeRemarks: Better house keeping, sweep and mop the floor daily!

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText:
I was staying in the newly remodeled side of the hotel. Was outstanding. I stayed at HYATT in Sacramento and loved it as much as this one. I was told that by November the rest of the rooms will be remodeled, defenetly will stay there again.
The only thing I would like to see is entrance to the second level from front right side, since right now there I's only one in the middle and in the back so kind of have to do a circle.
Also for breakfast some egg and sausage :)

review.title: Shoddy upgrades but a comfortable room
review.reviewText: The room and facilities have a lot of potential, however all upgrades were executed poorly. Basically, the idea was to upgrade the room with new furnishings and fixtures. But the exposed exterior screws, wall panel, and legacy commode showed a lack of care. Also, we had no lock on the first floor bathroom. It looked like there had been a lock at some time, but it was removed for some unknown reason. There was an ironing board and wall mount for the iron, but no iron. I assume the iron was lost with the lock in the land of misfit repairs. finally, the nice new bathroom faucet was mounted improperly and consequently wobbled like a deformed bobble head. Since the pile of rubble and garbage was outside the room, and piled behind a nice new wall, I could almost ignore it, if it wasn't for the 50 gallon drums protruding above the pile and 1/2 wall.

review.title: Old dirty room
review.reviewText: The room was extremely hot. There was no A/C and electrical wires hanging off the wall was exposed. To cool the room you had to open the windows and listen to the freeway all night. The bathroom was covered in mold and mildew. Staff didn't care and was indifferent. The free breakfast was store bought Danishes. Horrible experience.

photos.caption: The view in-front of the motel
The view in-front of the motel

review.title: Nice hotel, very close to Sausalito :)
review.reviewText: Really nice, clean, quite hotel, very close to a tourism area. The room was very clean, the bath also, better than some 3+ stars hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great, very close to Golden Gate and tourism area in Sausalito.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast is very basic! First day I didn't get anything :) for the second day, there was no Juice :)
review.locationRemarks: Sausalito is one of the top tourism locations near SF. I highly recommend going there.

review.reviewText: The hotel was outdated, but I loved the full kitchen.

review.title: Last minute booking
review.reviewText: This hotel turned out to be a lot nicer then the rest of the Best Value I've stayed at. The room has been upgraded and remodel. Nice tile flooring, bedding and decorations. The only downside for us was the pillows. It was on the harder side.
review.positiveRemarks: Flooring and decorations. Looks and feel a lot cleaner.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do nearby. SF is only 15 minutes away. There's a lot to do in Sausalito as well as Tiburon to do.

review.title: Nights stay
review.reviewText: Remodeled room was nice.  Older motel but it was clean and comfy.

review.title: I woud NOT recommend this motel
review.reviewText:
The key to the door didn't work and I had to go back to the office three times to finally get into my room.  The safety lock on the door was missing. There were no drinking glasses or cups in the room.  The sheets had just been thrown on the bed. The bed was not made.  The overall appearance of the room was tacky.  Garbage was piled behind my room and the birds were spreading it all over the parking lot.  Birds had roosted over the stairs going up to my room and the stairs were covered with bird droppings.  The staff didn't seem to care about my complaints. Some member of the staff had a baby on site that screamed
 during the evening.

All and all, my stay was totally unacceptable.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing!
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything starting with the attitude of the owners/staff

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Staff was nice, Room size good, walls needed to be cleaned and repainted. Beds big and clean. Our bathroom had Mold all over ceiling....

Very loud day and night due to main street right in front of our Room. No AC working and stinky from cigarrets smoke so you have to leave windows open.

Outside is looking good and owner is working on maintaining it. But they are missing the point....Keep Room for the customer clean and updated :( Won't be going back.

review.title: Mill Valley Motel
review.reviewText: Good location for the City or as stop over. The room was clean and spacious however not enough drawer space for a family room. The floor was swept and not cleaned. Though breakfast was included there was nowhere to eat it apart from our room which was not set up for eatting more than a snack. It was very noisy from people walking on the upper floor and the traffic. Its more to do with the acoustics then people and cars. The main issue was the unhelpfulness of the staff who ran it. They were polite but every request was greeted with 'I dont know'. This is in contrast to the experience we've had in other Motels/hotels. If staying here, ask for top floor room!
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude to guests
review.locationRemarks: Great for San Francisco and Muir Woods

review.title: Visiting Muir Woods
review.reviewText: Free Continental Breakfast was insufficient and there no seating area.

review.title: Good overnight stay
review.reviewText: Clean and tidy close to San Francisco and Muir forest. Basic breakfast

photos.caption: width of room is a king size bed

review.title: Nice hotel for overnight
review.reviewText: Room was nicely updated but a little small.  Went to make coffee in the morning and the coffee filter from previous users was still in there.  There were two long black hairs on my blanket when I lifted the top bedspread off.  There was also a yellow stain on the white bottom sheet on one side.  Not sure if it was just a stain or if the sheets weren't changed.  I ended up putting a bath towel over it to sleep on.  We had a room on the back of hotel where it was less noisy than front facing rooms toward busy road.  No elevator so you have to carry your luggage up stairs to second floor.  The walls between rooms are very, very thin!!  Unfortunately, we had very talkative people beside us and could hear them talking all evening so was very annoying.  You can also hear the water running when shower is on.
review.positiveRemarks: The renovated room.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaner blankets, more sound - proofing. Coat hooks on wall to hang coats.
review.locationRemarks: Handy location to Muir Woods.

review.title: Not worth the money even at the discounted price!
review.reviewText: The room was tiny, paper thin walls, the air conditioning, shower, microwave, and frig were all extremely loud. WIFI was in and out. The topper was major construction going on right behind hotel, giant boulders being moved and crushed, cement trucks making excessive noise, construction works yelling to each other. This all took place from 7:30 until 5:30. No warning was given and the management did not care about the disturbance to guest. When asked for a further discount because of the disturbance the management was extremely rude and flat out did not give one bit that it was an issue. I would never stay in this pit of a motel - America's Best? What a joke - this is AMERICA'S WORST!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: Great location beside the road noise which there is a lot of. Great hikes close by - close to freeway - near Mill Valley, Sausalito and SF

review.title: economy hotel no frills
review.reviewText: No AC or room fan to cool room.Noisy commuter rd but quiet later in evening. Easy access to freeway. breakfast was not extensive had to make multiple trip as no trays to carry drinks ,pastry and fruit.
review.positiveRemarks: I had business in San Francisco in the morning and easy commute with parking included
review.negativeRemarks: room fans as AC not required if they had room fans.
review.locationRemarks: sightseeing is nearby

review.title: Nice Room
review.reviewText: The newly remodeled room was a pleasant surprise belied by the somewhat rough exterior.  We were very satisfied with our value for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly updated room was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Exterior
review.locationRemarks: Good stop off coming out of San Fran near Muir Woods and Sonoma Valley.

review.title: This hotel is being renovated.
review.reviewText: I stayed in a newly renovated room on the back side of the hotel away from the the busy highway in front. It was a reasonable quiet room with all new interior. This is not a five star hotel but if one is looking for economical accommodations that are clean and without too many frills, this is the best I have found in this area. I go there often and will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was clean comfortable and it all worked as it was supposed to.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom lavatory was modern but hot and cold water were hooked up backward so the sinle lever control had to be turned to the hot side for cold.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Sausalito, San Francisco, and Napa wine country but far more reasonable than hotels in those locations but only minutes from each by car

review.title: Clean, comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Motel undergoing renovation. Our room newly redone. You could hear construction in the morning. The room was nice and very comfortable.
hotel was clean, quiet, & appeared recently remodeled.   bed was super comfortable.   handycap facilities very nice.   definitely will go there again.
review.positiveRemarks: clean & quiet & most important low in price!!!
review.negativeRemarks: they need an elevator for the handycapped to be able to use the second floor rooms.
review.locationRemarks: location was close to sausalito which was of importance to us.

review.title: Convenient location and decent for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms were large and spacious. The beds were comfortable. The room seemed reasonably clean but the overall building and site were cluttered and in disrepair.

Over all I was pleased with my stay at this hotel, The rooms are nice and they are big. The bedding was nice as well. My only complaints are that they ran out of roll a way beds before we got there. If you need one, you should call ahead and see if you can reserve one.  And the window in the bathroom was left open and ants were crawling in.
review.negativeRemarks: They could offer a continental breakfast, instead of just juice and coffe.

review.title: Very Close to our Family's home
review.reviewText: It was so close to our Family's Home and mins. away from Sausalito! Perfect!!!

review.title: Room was dirty. Ants in bathroom.
review.reviewText: Unclean. Internet poor. Continental breakfast nonexistent. Fire hazard with heating. Would never ever stay here again even if it was free.

review.title: Overpriced and ordinary.
review.reviewText: This room is worth about $100 per night and no more.     Room was basic although the bed was comfortable.   Hotel is a stone's throw away from Highway 1 so there is traffic noise.      Lady in reception was very hard to understand.    Breakfast was a joke.      It was take a pastry and bad coffee back to you room.        We stayed here because everywhere else in town was booked but it would not be a place I would bother to go back to.

review.title: Overpriced !
review.reviewText:
I wanted a nice hotel that's why I paid more than $200. I've stayed at embassy, Holliday inn, and many others in Marin for the same or less money and they were much better. I needed to stay in mill valley that's why I booked This hotel... The hotel looked old, old furniture, very noise outside my window, hot and no AC, for $220 I expected much more !
Will not stay again or recommend to other people unless the price is away less.

review.title: Nice hotel on the water front
review.reviewText: Didn't look too promising from the outside, but was really nice in the inside... Room was nice and comforting.

review.title: The Price is Right
review.reviewText: The rooms are large and have fridges, hair dryers and irons. It was easy to get to SF from this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The large rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to buy new towels. Ours were thin and old. The breakfast is very minimal.
review.locationRemarks: There is a nice hike to the beach close and it is just a short drive to Sausalito. We had no trouble getting to SF from this hotel.

review.title: Good,Bad and Ugly
review.reviewText: The desk clerks were less than helpful. The first was on her second day with no knowledge. It took her 15 minutes to stop telling me that I did not have a reservation. The second could not speak or understand english. The room was hugh with a walk-in closet but the entire facility was old and ill-maintained (The Bad). The bed was excellant (The Good). The bathroom had ants (The Ugly). My impression is that the owner is milking his investment, putting little or nothing into operation and maintenance. But if you are hard-up for a room near the beaches, you can do as I did and hope the reviews are incorrect.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else
review.locationRemarks: not too very far from the beaches

review.title: Low Quality Motel
review.reviewText: They had an outside the office vending machine that didn't work, but no sign saying that. After I tried it and it didn't work, I told the manager who said it, yes, he knew that but wouldn't refund the money. After I put a sign on it saying it was broken, he took the sign down . I'm sure this left the next guest to have the same problem.

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: No air conditioning, no coffee pot in room, coffee maker in lobby was putting out cold coffee, no clock in room, hair dryer worked intermittently, this was a $179.00 room, i expected better.
review.positiveRemarks: It was night, i was in a strange town, it was a place to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Just read the above.
review.locationRemarks: I did not even look, i just packed my bags and left.

review.title: Close to San Francisco & Muir woods.
review.reviewText: Staff was helpful, the room was clean, close to the 101. The price was very reasonable.

review.title: Parking is easy. Window facing street is noisy.
review.reviewText: We spent 2 nights there. Bed is large and cozy. Room is spacious. Cleanness is basically OK. Too noisy at daybreak vehicle steering in high speed can be heard.

review.title: Nice Hotel very close to the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, clean and staff very helpful. I was surprise the Hotel is really clean offering a continental breakfast, it was nice and neat.

review.title: Don't even consider it!
review.reviewText: Holes in walls. Mold everywhere. Staff inattentive. Low water pressure. No coffee maker. Verge of being a crack house.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: everything!

review.title: Do not recommend
review.reviewText: Absolutely not what you expect for the price. Painting/repairs were going on at night. Not a pleasant experience. No apologies from the staff for the noise

review.title: i dont recomend this hotel
review.reviewText: building and rooms in very poor repair and not what i consider well cleaned, the room had no way to ventilate it with fresh air without leaving the doors and windows wide open, the room was stiffling hot upon check-in and most of the night. there is no way to secure the windows partially open with any way to prevent them from bieng entered by someone from the porch out front, there was provided a small plastic table fan that i had to fix in order to use. you couln't leave the bathroom window unlocked or open because the people walking past on the back walkway can see right in to the shower and toilet, and that window is also low enough and big enough for some one to enter through with ease. the wall light switches had motion sensors in them that would flash a very bright green led in them every time anything moved in the room even when turned off. the seat on the wood chair at the desk in the room was not screwed the chair and would fall to the floor if you tried to sit in it. there was a coffee maker at the checkin desk but was very messy with grounds and stains on the top of machine where it looks like the beans or grounds are poured in. there was a pleasant person that come out to the desk at checkin, but in all my other trips to that office no one ever came back out.
review.positiveRemarks: cant think of anything positive.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: close to sausalito and marinas.

review.title: Good price, but needs updated
review.reviewText:
I paid $128 per night which is very cheap in Marin. However, the rooms could really use some updating. It appears that they are trying to do some work outside, but I would prefer the rooms be done first.

The rooms and bathroom were very large. I thought they were supposed to have kitchenettes but when I got into my room, rm 108, I discoved a locked door inside. Apparently, that is where the kitchenette used to be but since it doesn't work, they just locked it up.

Since there was no air conditioners in the room, we had to leave the window open for air flow. People were smoking outside of the room, second hand smoke would come into the room. We also had to leave the window open at night, so we heard all the noise from outside.

The location is great. If this hotel can make some updates, I would stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner in rooms Breakfast Update room
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway. Close to Muir Woods, Stinson Beach, San Francisco

review.title: gloomy unable to open curtain/overlook parking
review.reviewText:
bedcover worn out or not clean. extra door next to bathroom questionable it is either overlooking another room?
or some kind of storage. lock similar to the motel door but unable to open and check what it is in that room.
towels look old from wear and tear. No coffee maker! the coffee served at their reception with small cups!
considering the price of $ 122 the 1st night! a little abusive. with No light breakfast.
Just because in a fancy area? so what??
the owners of the motel not friendly or professionally nice. I am glad i was outdoor most of the day.
i asked another room top floor. Hotel owner was not concerned and simply confirmed no room upstairs.
But was disappointed i cancelled second day booking?? they do not seem to care much about customer service
review.positiveRemarks: Room spacious and has a small desk besides the entrance table. appliances ideal but no individual coffee maker?
review.negativeRemarks: Windows.. to have some discretion. Tinted maybe to be able to see outside without being seen.
review.locationRemarks: Great, Italian restaurant and ideal to walk there, alongside the water,the view where the bridge crosses the water.

review.title: not the place for single women, very intimidating.
review.reviewText: I thought it was suppose to be 'family friendly', it looked to be prostitute friendly & dealer friendly.

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff were excellent.
Took a chance to check in early and my room was already set up.
A lovely little bonus was that there was free coffee during the stay at the reception area. Would only recommend this hotel if you have transport

review.title: Slept well but otherwise disappointing
review.reviewText: Bed was comforable, but otherwise the place is run down. Wireless internet didn't work and they didn't know, or really care, to fix it.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: no internet

review.title: Good value for money!!
review.reviewText:
Good value for money. If you are planning to visit Muir woods area this is a good place. Very spacious room with walk-in closet!!!! Heater in the room, no AC though. Good restaurants around. The location is ideal for travelers being bang on 101. Surprisingly very nice sound proof rooms. Breakfast needs a lot of improvements - Juice was diluted to an extent that it tasted like nothing, no bread/toast just some bearclaws and coffee.
Plenty of parking available and free WiFi.
We were 3 adults in a room and they didn't charge extra for additional person.

review.title: Look elsewhere!
review.reviewText: Horribly outdated and rundown. No AC, room looks like a do-it-yourself garage conversion!! Room was about 30 - 40% overpriced.

review.title: Good hotel for family
review.reviewText: I didn't really expect much when I first booked it. My family and I needed some rooms for the night, and this is the only hotel that had rooms to spare. I booked two rooms (2 queen beds, and 1 standard king). I was asked if I prefer the second or first floor, and I requested the two rooms next to each other. Both requests were granted, so I was pretty happy. The rooms were pretty spacious and clean, beds were comfortable, staff was polite and friendly, & they provide free breakfast (muffins, danish, coffee, etc). Overall, it was a pleasant experience :)

review.title: OK, but...
review.reviewText: Worked for me as a business traveller. Cost should have been $10 less per night to compare with similar locations in the area.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location to SF; Refrig. and Microwave; WiFi when it worked.
Room service staff did a good job of cleaning the room including the bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks:
Hotel is very old and more upgrades needed. A good start, but a long way to go.
On site management needs a little more hospitality training.
review.locationRemarks: Located next to a well travelled 2 way road with significant road noise experienced. Close to San Francisco and Marin County malls.

review.title: One of the nicest low priced motels
review.reviewText:
I rated this one highly because for the price, the comfort is unreal. The beds were superbly comfortable and new, the room came with a frig, microwave, flat screen TV, cable, comfy furniture, and despite it being on a main artery, the windows protected against the street noise. The rooms were spotless and smelled fresh. The furniture and carpets aren't the most fashion forward, but for the location, price, and comfort, grading it down for that is being small.

I graded the appearance slightly down as the parking lot and outer appearance make it look a little slummy, don't let that fool you. It's more comfy on the inside than it looks. My only complaint was I needed ice and I was handed a small bag instead of me being able to fill up the bags I needed for my cooler. For the money I saved on the hotel price, I could go buy a bag of ice for my cooler. and still be way ahead.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy bed, nice blankets, large rooms
review.negativeRemarks: deceivingly grungy outer appearance.
review.locationRemarks: off highway 101 in MIll Valley area, on highway 1.

review.title: Shoddy room - poor housekeeping
review.reviewText:
At best, minimally satisfied. Repairs had been made to bath, but not completed. Maid service was minimal - had to remind her to clean bath and remove empty toiletriy items.
Continental breakfast also minimal - no eating area required several trips to room to carry breakfast items.
At this price, should have had better accomodations
review.locationRemarks: Not aware of any - did not observe any nicer motels in area.

review.title: It's a room.
review.reviewText: I'll try the Travel Lodge down the street next time.

review.title: Americas Best Value Inn & Suites / should be Americas WORST Value Inn & Suites
review.reviewText: Checked in late with two young children, Asked for a room best suited for 4 people. The room had no closet, but did have a boarded up doorway that may have once been a closet. At the opposite end of the room there was a boarded up area that may have led out to a hall or something, and was primed in different color paints. The bathroom had no shelves of any kind to put any bathroom stuff, no counter of any kind to put anything. I had to move a table from the room into the bathroom to put all of our bathroom stuff (me / wife / 2 kids). There were no towels anywhere to be found. When I went to the front desk to talk about the room, she said she could move us to a better room; I told her the kids were already changed for bed, and if she had a better room, why didn't she put us in there in the first place? The towels she gave us were warm, probably just out of the dryer? But they had stains all over them ... gross! The water pressure in the shower was appalling. You could hear every noise from the rooms next to us, and when the people walked in the room above us it was like an earthquake. The "breakfast" provided was a 1 X 1 shelf in the tiny front desk area with coffee and muffins or something like that; we didn't bother going and found a local family friendly restaurant instead. This "hotel" is basically a VERY old MOTEL with a new name on it ... you'd be better off / more comfortable bringing a tent with you and camping out in a field. Other than that, it was fine.

review.title: too expensive
review.reviewText: too expensive in weekend, given the location and quality of services, too far San Francisco; too near the street

review.title: Neat roadside inn
review.reviewText: Room was spaceous and comfortable. It was easy to find the hotel. It's located close to San Francisco, just a little bit off the highway.

review.title: Nice value, great location!
review.reviewText: Very good value I would have to say, the motel was older and it looks like they were apartment conversions. There was a kitch/refrigerator/stove inside but I do believe it was to be used, refrig. unplugged and stove looked about 40 years old. The rest of the room was very up to date and clean and I really like the location, 10 minutes into SF and only about 15 minutes to get up into Novato and the surrounding communities, very happy overall for the price.

review.title: Will never go back
review.reviewText: The door lock does not work and had to call the hotel management 3 times to get it to open and yet he insisted that it works.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: very clean, cozy,close to my training, and to stores, downtown etc.

review.title: Bad Highway Access
review.reviewText: The hotel had a makeover and was the only reason that I can recommend it. The lobby was filled with smoke upon check-in. Access to and from the hotel is very difficult due to traffic on Hwy 1 going to and from Stinson Beach.

review.title: Really low end of acceptable
review.reviewText: Old place right on major highway, noisy, no A/C or fan; barely acceptable for a single guy

review.title: When there is no other choice
review.reviewText: If there is absoolutely no other choice, then this place works. It is on a very busy street, is very old feeling. Comforter and pillows were sun damaged and falling apart. Bathroom reminded me of my college dorm.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: My father stayed at this hotel and I wished that I had checked it out before booking it for him...the room smelled like mold and it was generally pretty depressing. Its one of the cheapest hotels in the area and I can see why...I guess they have to sell it at that price to afford to be in Marin but it would be nice if they made an effort to keep it up a little more.

review.title: Least Expensive in the area.
review.reviewText: Great TV. Unlimited coffee in the morning if you're willing to keep going to the office for it, cup by cup. Basically clean and functioning with a good wall heating system though a little drafty with some aspects (e.g., frames of doors & windows) partially painted and under repair)

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: The room and the walk-in closet are spacious; the TV is nice and new. However,the temperature in the bathroom equals the outside temperature - 38 degrees. Moreover, hot water in the 21st century should not be a luxury. It is a necessity that the motel does not provide!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Hotel owner is a nice friendly guy. Room was spacious. Bed was comfortable. Kitchen, room and bathroom were clean and adequate. Price was right. This place deserves more that 2 stars even though it's old. What's wrong with old?

review.title: horrid
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I were completly disgusted with this hotel and would not wish for someone to stay there, ever. there was blood on the walls, the check-in man was a rude jerk and they were anything but helpful. i was leterally frightened for my life adn ended up checking into another motel at midnight. We were really upset and out of money. I would recommend you no longer carry them in your services.

review.title: Old and run down
review.reviewText: Old and run down

review.title: Gross!
review.reviewText: There was a kitchen in our room that was filthy and had left over chinese and wine in it. It was the kind of place you wouldn't go barefoot!

review.title: comment:
review.reviewText: Unfriendly--no smile or thank you. No tissue; no spare toilet paper; had to ask for a TV remote, towels (everyday!); no ice bucket (I guess I should have asked?), etc. Right on the busy street--very noisy all night.

review.title: Not for the faint of heart
review.reviewText: This hotel should be your last resort for a place to stay. Located right off of the freeway, it is noisy. The room I stayed in had a lock missing on the door and necessitated the use of furniture to secure the room. Would not recommend to any traveler unless they had no other option.

review.title: Best Value inn -Mill Valley ca
review.reviewText: room was bigger and nicer then most in this price range. staff could have been friendlier.
